1.text: Pour your lemon juice into an ice tray.

2.text: Place the ice cube tray in the freezer overnight or until the lemon juice is solid.

3.text: Pop the lemon cubes out of trays once they’re frozen.

4.text: Place the cubes into a resealable plastic bag.

5.text: Label the bag and return the cubes to the freezer.

6.text: Thaw the lemon juice or place the frozen cubes directly into a recipe.

7.text: Sanitize several half-pint jars and lids.

8.text: Pour your lemon juice into a medium saucepan and heat it to a low boil.

9.text: Fill your canner halfway with water and bring it to a boil.

10.text: Pour the juice into the jars and seal them.

11.text: Lower each jar into the boiling water in the canner.

12.text: Close the lid on the canner and process the jars for 15 minutes.

13.text: Remove the jars from the water carefully and let them cool.

14.text: Label the jars and store them in a cool, dry place.
